abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Economic Management
            Support Project for Burundi were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            institutional strengthening and capacity building projects,
            though assessed for their contributory value in a broader
            reform process, must still be constructed with maximum
            internal cohesion and coherence. The results framework must
            always contain target values for project development
            objective, or PDO and intermediate outcomes and the number
            of measurable indicators should not be attenuated. The
            separation of powers constitutionally means distinct
            governance structures pertain in this sector. If added to
            this the judicial systems are under severe strain and held
            in especially low regard by the population (as is the case
            in Burundi), it must be questionable if the range of issues
            can be satisfactorily addressed in a project encompassing
            diverse other sectors. The supervision of big infrastructure
            works tend to be time-consuming for Project Coordinating
            Unit, or PCU, affecting the quality of supervision for other
            activities covered under the project. As recommendation for
            the future, the procurement process for such high value
            civil works contract should be handled separately by
            infrastructures project.
